alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 5:31AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Areas of Dense Fog Have Developed North of I-4... At 530 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras show that areas of dense fog had developed across Lake County, and adjacent sections of western Volusia, Seminole and northwestern Orange Counties. Visibilities had dropped to one half mile or less in some locations. The fog is expected to linger past sunrise, eventually burning off between 8 and 9 AM. If you will be out driving early this morning, prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility due to dense fog. When Driving in dense fog, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of driving distance between your car and the one in front of you. If the dense fog becomes more widespread, then a Dense Fog Advisory will be issued.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County
